events.comment: Hi from America, Boki! This dish is called a â€œseafood boilâ€ because, traditionally in the low country, all of the seafood is boiled together in one big pot, then dumped on a table so that everyone can eat together. The boiling water is seasoned with many spices to make the seafood flavorful. Traditionally, there is also corn, potatoes, and sausage in the mix with the seafood, as these things fill in the places in your stomach that the light seafood donâ€™t fill up. You did an excellent job with yours! It looked amazing!! Such a pleasure to see. Enjoy!
events.reply: i was coming to make the same comment! <3

Hello everyone ! This is Boki
Today, I brought Spicy Boyling Seafood that I really wanted to try!
I got 4kg king crab, tiger shrimp, scallops, palm-sized abalone, lobster from the fish market, I prepared large ingredients!
I melted butter, added minced garlic, pepper, and buldak sauce to the Boiling crab seasoning, and then stir-fried it with seafood!
It's spicy, sweet and very stimulating, The butter flavor was perfect, too!
It was big one by one, so the chewy texture was the best when the mouth was fullğŸ« 
Enjoy your meal too

Hey you. Yes, you. You're probably scrolling through the comments, like I am, reading all these motivational comments. If you are reading this at night, you should get some sleep, and don't stress about everything going on in the world, or what you are going through. Don't dwell on things from the past, don't stress on your future. Just live your life, because you only get one. Do whatever makes you happy, not what other people want from you. For me, I'm gonna wake up tomorrow morning, get some exercise, and cherish life for the amazing blessing that it is. I hope you do the same and have an amazing day as well! Stay safe and stay relaxed <3

events.comment: Hey you. Yes, you. You're probably scrolling through the comments, like I am, reading all these motivational comments. If you are reading this at night, you should get some sleep, and don't stress about everything going on in the world, or what you are going through. Don't dwell on things from the past, don't stress on your future. Just live your life, because you only get one. Do whatever makes you happy, not what other people want from you. For me, I'm gonna wake up tomorrow morning, get some exercise, and cherish life for the amazing blessing that it is. I hope you do the same and have an amazing day as well! Stay safe and stay relaxed <3

events.comment: hey to you reading this (: whatever brings you here, wether it's to fall asleep or to relax from something stressful, i just wanted to let you know that everything will be fine. If you're going through a hard time right now, it's okay to remind yourself that this is temporary, and there are many good and relaxing days to come. If you're about to sleep, i hope you will have the most beautiful dreams, and the most peaceful sleep. You are an amazing person and the world is lucky to have someone like you in it. I hope only good things, love and strenth will come your way. Goodnight (: <3

events.comment: Bought this keyboard after watching a few videos like these. I can confirm that they do sound like this in person. Unlike HHKBs, the FC660C has a metal plate like realforce boards, but the domes are also slightly snappier. I used tribosys 3204 instead for the slider and it has the same effect.
events.reply: @W topre is pretty comfy to type on for hours on end, i know some programmers typing all day that use topre. Pretty sure he lubed the sliders and stabs

events.comment: Bought this keyboard after watching a few videos like these. I can confirm that they do sound like this in person. Unlike HHKBs, the FC660C has a metal plate like realforce boards, but the domes are also slightly snappier. I used tribosys 3204 instead for the slider and it has the same effect.
events.reply: @W You have lube both sides of each slider (used 3204), and then lube the stabilizers (used 205g0) to reduce the rattle. The less, the better it is. DBOKEY has another video going through the process. Takes a bit of time (2h for me) but well worth it. I can personally type much longer on topre boards compared to MX style since the typing experience is softer. Also, I make less mistake touch typing because of the tactility.

events.reply: @cashapp.  I bought one from mechmarket for like 170usd. They are not very common nowadays. If you include both lubes I used and some foam inside the case, it's around 210usd the entire build.

This sounds like the storm thats happening outside where i live right now. its just rain and grey clouds, this video here makes me think of a story ill tell it as you're listening to this amazing sound of the keyboard.

THE STORY 

A teenage boy and girl were at the funfair when they started to feel rain slowly dropping down on them, they didn't think to much about it as it was only a spit of soft rain. A couple of moments later the rain went into hard forced rain thunder struck as the light ling slowly appeared through the black sky. As the storm got bigger the sea started to crash, some people got wet of the salty water of the dark blue sea. The two teenagers were on their way home because of the storm the boy said "look sorry today wasn't the best day to pick" the teenage girl smiled and slowly holded the boys hand  the girl looked into the boys eyes and said "this was the best day ever.." the boy slowly looked at the girl with a smile. They went home and the boy said that he liked her and that she liked him, then it was a great day for both of them.

As the storm got bigger the sea started to crash, some people got wet of the salty water of the dark blue sea. The two teenagers were on their way home because of the storm the boy said "look sorry today wasn't the best day to pick" the teenage girl smiled and slowly holded the boys hand  the girl looked into the boys eyes and said "this was the best day ever.." the boy slowly looked at the girl with a smile. They went home and the boy said that he liked her and that she liked him, then it was a great day for both of them.
events.reply: Good plot, try learning more vocabulary to make your sentences less complex. Instead of saying "They went home and the boy said that he liked her and that she liked him" you could say "After they returned home, they both confessed their love for each other"

events.reply:
@kumacomputer  Actually that's incorrect. Any switch, no matter how clicky is that loud. A lot of the sound is amplified is amplified by the hollow shape of the keycap over the switch. And then if the keycap hits the case when it bottoms out, that adds to the sound as well. Plus the case material adds to the sound and the type of sound you get. Aluminum, acrylic, wood. Filled with foam or hollow, weighted or plated. Are the keycaps double shot plastic? Brass? Acrylic-filled artisans? Stabilizers? Films? Lubes? 

All of these components and their endless combinations form the symphony of sound that is a mechanical keyboard.

Bought this keyboard after watching a few videos like these. I can confirm that they do sound like this in person. Unlike HHKBs, the FC660C has a metal plate like realforce boards, but the domes are also slightly snappier. I used tribosys 3204 instead for the slider and it has the same effect.
events.reply: just have one question, are they mushy like mebranes or are they basically mechanicalls?

events.comment: Bought this keyboard after watching a few videos like these. I can confirm that they do sound like this in person. Unlike HHKBs, the FC660C has a metal plate like realforce boards, but the domes are also slightly snappier. I used tribosys 3204 instead for the slider and it has the same effect.
events.reply: @xiaomingthecatdoctor.6753  It's hard to explain if you never typed on a topre board. The actuation starts at the top which is different from mx tactile or clicky switches. You can say that the bump is "rounder" and the its smooth all the way down. Unlike membranes, you feel the travel distance and the bottom out is not mushy... I would say its soft instead. Also, you often bottom out on these switches and the upstroke is strong (produces most of its sound). Overall, topre are my favorite switches for work since its smooth, responsive, and feels great after long use periods. So, to answer your question, topre is not membrane or mechanical, these are rubber domes. If you want a soft and responsive typing experience, most people would agree that topre is the way to go. However, like most things, its all subjective.

events.comment: Bought this keyboard after watching a few videos like these. I can confirm that they do sound like this in person. Unlike HHKBs, the FC660C has a metal plate like realforce boards, but the domes are also slightly snappier. I used tribosys 3204 instead for the slider and it has the same effect.

This sounds like the storm thats happening outside where i live right now. its just rain and grey clouds, this video here makes me think of a story ill tell it as you're listening to this amazing sound of the keyboard.

THE STORY 

A teenage boy and girl were at the funfair when they started to feel rain slowly dropping down on them, they didn't think to much about it as it was only a spit of soft rain. A couple of moments later the rain went into hard forced rain thunder struck as the light ling slowly appeared through the black sky. As the storm got bigger the sea started to crash, some people got wet of the salty water of the dark blue sea. The two teenagers were on their way home because of the storm the boy said "look sorry today wasn't the best day to pick" the teenage girl smiled and slowly holded the boys hand  the girl looked into the boys eyes and said "this was the best day ever.." the boy slowly looked at the girl with a smile. They went home and the boy said that he liked her and that she liked him, then it was a great day for both of them.
events.reply: Sorry if this story was cringe, its what i thought of hearing this keyboard.
